    • Method Detail

      • getVisibilityArray

        public boolean[][] getVisibilityArray(byte direction)
        Makes and returns an array of booleans, each representing whether that square is visible to the player. Used by a UserInterface to figure out what to display to the player. It makes the array by asking the player what squares it can see (probably by checking the player's powerups) and by calling the grid's getPosition method on the object to construct the array. This array will then be used by the UI to construct a representation of the game state.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction the player is looking, represented as a byte. 0 = up, 1 = right, 2 = down, and 3 = left.
        Returns:
        an array of booleans, with true meaning that square is visible to the player and false meaning that that square is not visible to the player.

      • setupGrid

        public void setupGrid()
        This method instantiates the Grid object for a new game. It also handles the placement of all Locatable objects.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Saves the game-state by using the FileManager to record the grid, and other miscellaneous attributes like turnCount.

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame()
        Loads the gamestate using the FileManager, and initializes the grid, and other miscellaneous attributes like turnCount.
